firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to change power state to
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Power Management driver was unable to transition a device to the desired power state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPmStateTransitionFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Power Management driver refused to transition a device from going from a lower power (deeper) state to a higher power (shallower) state if the state is not D0 in accordance with ACPI 6.0.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPmStateTransitionNotAllowed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot transition to power state .* for parent
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Power Management driver was unable to transition a parent device into a power state because it does not support that particular power state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPmStateNotSupportedByParent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Power Management driver was unable to transition a device into a specific power state because the device did not specify it supported this power state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPmStateNotSupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: e820: cannot find a gap in the 32bit address range
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A search for the biggest gap in the low 32 bit E820 memory space for PCI MMIO resources failed to find any free gaps large enough. PCI devices with unassigned 32 bit Base Address Registers (BARs) are very likely to break.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosE820NoGapAvailable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI core driver cannot disable ACPI when returning back to legacy mode.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDisableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI core driver has attempted to load the ACPI namespace but failed because there is no ACPI Differentiated System Description Table (DSDT) available.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDsdtNotInMemory

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: CPPC data invalid or not present
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI processor driver has detected missing or invalid Collaborative Processor Performance Control (CPPC) data.  The ACPI per CPU _CPC objects may be missing or broken.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCppcDataInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI battery driver has detected that the Battery Information Extended (_BIX) object seems to be broken and has fallen back to using the less modern Battery Information (_BIF) object instead to get battery specific data.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBixBroken

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS reported wrong ACPI id .* for the processor
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI processor enumaration detected an invalid ACPI ID for a specific processor. This is not fatal, but the kernel will not trust the ACPI data for this specific processor.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiProcessorInvalidId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI virtual address has wrapped around and overflowed and may cause random or unexplicable faulty EFI behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiVaAddrRangeOverflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI driver failed to map physical addresses to virtual addresses on a range of EFI related pages.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiPhysVirtMappingFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel text region failed to be mapped 1 to 1 (physical to virtual).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiKernelTextOneToOneMapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to allocate EFI runtime stack < 4GB
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI stack must be addressible with 32 bit pointers and hence less than 4GB, however a stack in the 32 bit address range could not be allocated and the boot cannot proceed (kernel panic).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfi32BitStackNotAllocated

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to create 1:1 mapping for the first page
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The firmware still believes it is the exclusive owner of the first physical page of the EFI mapping even though the firmware has marked it as EFI_CONVENTIONAL_MEMORY.  To avoid a triple fault if the firmware attempts to write-access the page, a 1:1 mapping is used, however, this failed to be created.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiOneToOneMappingFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The physical address of a newly memory mapped EFI region is not mapped into the EFI page table. Ident mapping failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiIdentMappingFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Setup done, disabling due to 32/64-bit mismatch
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechaism has unmapped the EFI memory map, EFI runtime services have been disabled because of a mismatch on firmware and kernel (32/64 bit mismatch).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkEfiDisabled

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism failed to remap the SMBIOS configuration tables.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkConfigRemapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not install new EFI memmap
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism could not install a memory region for the new EFI memmap region.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkEfiMemMapInstallFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to map new EFI memmap
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism could not remap a memory region for the new EFI memmap region.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkEfiMemMapRemapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to allocate new EFI memmap
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism could not allocate a memory region for the new EFI memmap region.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkEfiMemMapAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to map new boot services memmap
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism could not memory map a memory region for the EFI boot services, memory range could not be reserved.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkBootServesMemMapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not allocate boot services memmap
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism could not allocate a memory region for the EFI boot services, memory range could not be reserved.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkBootServicesAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism found that a memory range spanned one or more existing EFI memory descriptors and could not reserve it.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkMemDescSpanRegionsFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to lookup EFI memory descriptor for
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI quirk mechanism failed to find an EFI memory descriptor for a specific address; EFI memory could not be reserved.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiQuirkMemDescLookupFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An incorrect (empty) argument was passed to the EFI driver via the efi= kernel option
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiEmptyArgument

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to switch EFI into virtual mode
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI driver was unable to swith the EFI runtime services to virtual mode, the call to the EFI service SetVirtualAddressMap failed and the kernel panic'd
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiSwitchToVirtualModePanic

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to remap late EFI memory map
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI driver could not remap the late EFI memory page, runtime service calls will be disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiRemapLateMemoryMap

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Error reallocating memory, EFI runtime non-functional
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI driver could not reallocate memory, runtime service calls will be disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiReallocMemFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to remap late EFI memory map
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI driver could not install a new EFI memory map, runtime service calls will be disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiRemapEfiMemoryMapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to allocate EFI page tables
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI driver could not allocate EFI page tables when trying to enter EFI virtual mode, runtime service calls will be disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiPageTablesAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not map the firmware vendor
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI firmware vendor information could not be memory mapped, vendor information will be incorrect.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiMmapFirmwareVendorInfo

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not map the runtime service table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI runtime service table could not be mapped into memory, EFI has been disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiMmapRunTimeServiceTableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Warning: System table version .*, expected 1.00 or greater
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI system table version was less than 1.00, which is not expected.  EFI support has been allowed, even if the version looks old and/or wrong
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiSystemTableVersionIssue

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI system table header signature did not match the expected signature, EFI table is not trustworthy and EFI has been disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiBadSystemTableSignature

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: EFI data located above 4GB, disabling EFI
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The 32 bit system cannot memory map EFI data above the 32 bit address space limit of 4GB, EFI has been disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiDataAbove4GB

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The EFI system table could not be memory mapped, EFI support will be disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiMmapSystemTableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Memory map is above 4GB, disabling EFI
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The 32 bit system cannot memory map EFI data above the 32 bit address space limit of 4GB, EFI has been disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogEfiMmapAbove4GB

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI MWAIT C-state .* not supported by HW
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _CST (C-State) object is reporting a CPU C-State that the CPU does not actually support (as determined by CPUID_MWAIT_LEAF)
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCstateNotSupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI object name contained an invalid character and the ACPI core fixed this up. This incorrectly named object could cause incorrect execution behaviour of ACPI AMI code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidObjectName

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Platform took .* usec to enter ACPI mode
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI GPE took longer than expected to enter ACPI mode. This could lead to unexpected behaviour
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeEventEnterAcpiTooSlow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot release the ACPI Global Lock, it has not been acquired
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to release ACPI Global Lock failed, it had not been acquired previously.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalLockReleaseFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: UtTrackAllocation: Allocation .* already present in global list
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI memory tracking debug has detected an allocation that already exists in the global list of, this indicates a bug in the ACPICA core.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUtTrackDuplicateAllocation

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Attempt to delete a NULL address
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI memory tracking debug has detected an attempt to delete a NULL address, this indicates a bug in the ACPICA core.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUtTrackNullAddrDelete

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: The lid device is not compliant to SW_LID
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI button driver has detected a non compliant LID device switch. This can occur because the platform reports the lid as closed immediately after booting or resuming, or because the device never reports open events.  The ACPI button driver has inverted the LID switch event to try to ensure expected behaviour
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiLidInvertedSwitchEvent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The machine is a DELL that has switches sound between HDA and I2S depending on what the ACPI _REV object returns. The machine has been quirked to force _REV to return 5 to indicated sound should use HDA
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDellRev5Quirked

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI NFIT driver failed to get the NFIT sysfs directory entry
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogNfitSysfsDirentFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI NFIT driver failed to get the NFIT scrub sysfs directory entry
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogNfitScrubSysfsDirentFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Linux kernel currently only supports BIOS32 revision 0 and is ignoring an unsupported BIOS32 service directory structure.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBios32UnsupportedRevision

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PCI: BIOS32 entry .* in high memory, cannot use
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS32 service directory structure in located in high memory at or above address 0x100000 and cannot use this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBios32InHighMemory

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Boot Error Record Table (BERT) driver contained a record that was truncated and so it cannot print it.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBertShortErrorRecord

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Boot Error Record Table (BERT) driver found a status block that was truncated and so it cannot print it.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBertShortStatusBlock

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Boot Error Record Table (BERT) driver could not request the bert table data and cannot dump the boot error records.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBertIoMemRegionRequestFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Firmware does not respond in time
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver attempted to inject an error however the firmware took longer than expected to respond and a time-out occurred.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjFirmwareTimeout

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Can not request .* for Trigger table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver attempted to request a memory region for the APEI EINJ trigger table but the request failed, perhaps the mapping was incorrect.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjFailedMemRegion

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver attempted to IO remap the APEI EINJ trigger table, but the mapping failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjFailedIoremap

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver could not find an ACPI EINJ table, EINJ functionality is disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjNotFound

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver could not get an ACPI EINJ table, EINJ functionality is disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjGetFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection Table (EINJ) was invalid, possible because of an incorrect header length or an incorrect table size for the number of entries in the table.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver detected either an invalid Generic Address Structure (GAR) in an injection instruction entry, or resource space ID was not system memeory or system I/O.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjResourcesFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver failed to request system meory or system I/O port resources, EINJ functionality is disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjResourcesFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver failed to map the address spaces specified by the injection instruction entry Generic Address Structures (GAR), EINJ functionality is disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjGarMapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Error creating param extension debugfs nodes
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Error Injection (EINJ) driver failed to create debugfs nodes.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEinjDebugfsFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred when initializing the ACPI AML debugger so the debugger cannot be started.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlDebugInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to create AML debugger thread
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred when creating the ACPI AML debugger, a kernel thread could not be created so the debugger cannot be started.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlDebugThreadFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred when attempting to add an ACPI ARM AMBA device, the device allocation failed and the device has not enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmbaDevAddFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred when attempting to allocate an ACPI ARM AMBA device, the device allocation failed and the device has not enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmbaDevAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred waiting for the Platform Communication Channel communication channel to become available to the operating system. It seems to be still owned by the platform after too long a duration.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPccChannelBlocked

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI thermal zone control has been updated and an ACPI thermal zone has been disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThermalZoneDisabled

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: iort node pointer overflows, bad table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI IO Remapping Table (IORT) indicated it had more IORT nodes than were in the IORT table. Either the node count was incorrect or the table is truncated.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortBadTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI IO Remapping Table (IORT) driver could not register a Global System Interrupt (GSI) handler.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortGsiHandlerRegFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: requested ITS ID index .* is greater than available
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred trying to find an ACPI I/O Remapping Table (IORT) ITS identifier with a given index, index is out of range.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortItsIndexTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ID map has NULL parent reference
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI I/O Remapping Table (IORT) node output reference offset into the IORT is zero, which is clearly an firmware bug as it needs to be defined as an offset to the parent table. The node has been ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortNullRef

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SINGLE MAPPING flag not allowed for node type
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI I/O Remapping Table (IORT) node single mapping flag (bit 0 in node map flags) indicates that the node type is a single mapping node, however this is not allowed for this node. Ignoring node as this is a firmware bug in the IORT.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortIdMap

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter initialization failed and so ACPI has been disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDisabled

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: cannot allocate memory for new IOAPIC
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI APIC driver was unable to allocate memory while trying to add a new IOAPIC to the system; IOAPIC was ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIoapicNoMem

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error in the ACPI System Resource Affinity Table has been found, NUMA will not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratNotUsed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An unexpected ACPI System Resource Affinity Table header length has been detected, NUMA will not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratBadHeaderLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI System Resource Affinity Table has more proximity domains listed than the maximum kernel defined number of NUMA nodes. The Linux kernel CONFIG_NODES_SHIFT needs to be increaded.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratNumaNodeLimit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SRAT: Failed to add memblk to node
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI NUMA driver failed to add a NUMA memory block to a node. NUMA will not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNumaMemblkAddFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SRAT: Failed to mark hotplug range
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI NUMA driver failed to mark a NUMA memory plug as hotpluggable.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNumaMemblkHotplugFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Serial Port Console Redirection Table (SPCR) was expected to be at least version 2 or higher. APCI Serial Port Console will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSprWrongVersion

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: acpi resource window .* ignored, not CPU addressable
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI resource window could not be configured, the space was not addressable and has been ignored. One of the ACPI _CRS objects is incorrect. Check this with the fwts crsdump.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResourceWindowIgnored

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Limiting number of LPI states to max
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The number of CPU C States as returned by the _CST package is more than the ACPI Processor Idle driver supports. Limited it to a kerneld defined maximum.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCpuIdleLpiStatesMax

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: STAO table present, but SPCR is missing
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI _STA Override Table (STAO) exists and indicates that the STOA UART settings should be ignored and should use the SPCR, however there is no Serial Port Console Redirection Table containing serial port UART address information.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSpcrMissing

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: iort node pointer overflows, bad table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI ARM64 IORT driver detected an IORT node that is outside the ACPI IORT table. The table as been deemed to be broken and has been ignored
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortNodeOutsideTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI ARM64 IORT driver failed to register the GSI IRQ
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortIrqRegisterFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: requested ITS ID index .* is greater than available
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI ARM64 IORT driver failed to find a device by an ITS ID but the provided ID index is greater than the available ITS count, driver returned -ENXIO
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortBadItsIdIndex

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ID map has NULL parent reference
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI ARM64 IORT driver failed to get an IORT node ID, the map parent reference was NULL which is indicative of a firmware bug in the ACPI I/O Remapping Table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIortIdMapNull

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to create AML debugger thread
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver debugger failed to create a kernel thread to allow ACPI debugging, debugger failed to start
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlDebugThreadFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI AMBA device ARMH0061 (an ARM PL061 GPIO device) device add failed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmbaDevAddFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI AMBA device ARMH0061 (an ARM PL061 GPIO device) device allocate failed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmbaDevAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI memory hot-plug failed to enable a memory device
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMemHotPlugAddMemFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Limiting number of LPI states to max
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI C States (_CST) object contains more LPI states than the kernel has configired, so this has been limited to the maximum states allowed by the driver
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiLpiLimited

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI NFIT driver was unable to register a memory region because of an invalid System Physical Address (SPA)
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitInvalidSPA

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI NFIT driver was unable to install a notify handler for an NFIT NVDIMM device, device was marked as not available
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitNVDIMM

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI fan driver could not set the fan speed because the Fan Set Level (_FSL) control failed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFanFslSetFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI MADT subtable has been found with an invalid zero length. MADT parsing was aborted.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtZeroLengthSubTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS bug: multiple APIC/MADT found, using
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS is supposed to supply just one APIC/MADT, however, more than one has been found. One can use acpi_apic_instance=N to specify the Nth ACPI/MADT to use as an override if required.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMultipleMadt

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Override \[.*\], this is unsafe: tainting kernel
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: One or more ACPI tables have been overridden with replacement tables, this sets a taint bit in the kernel since this is an unsafe operation.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiKernelTainted

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI OVERRIDE: Table smaller than ACPI header
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An override ACPI table from kernel/firmware/acpi has an invalid ACPI table header size and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidOverrideTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An override ACPI table has an unknown ACPI table signature and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidOverrideTableSig

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI OVERRIDE: File length does not match table length
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An override ACPI table has an invalid length and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidOverrideTableLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An override ACPI table has an invalid checksum and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidOverrideTableChecksum

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS is supposed to supply just one APIC/MADT, however, more than one has been found.  Using a specific MADT table.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMadtSelected

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Generic Eventi Device (GED) Driver failed to execute an _EVT method when handling a GE interrupt in a kernel thread. Note: this error is reported only once, but may be occurring multiple times.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGedIrqExecFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Generic Event Device (GED) Driver failed to get IRQ resources for a GED, the evaluation of an ACPI _CRS object associated with it failed. The device will not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGedIrqCrsFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Generic Event Device (GED) Driver failed to find the _EVT method associated with the GED. The device will not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGedEvtNotAvailable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: failed to setup event handler for irq
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Generic Event Device (GED) Driver failed to start a kernel thread to handle the GED events. The device will not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGedHandlerFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Generic Event Device (GED) Driver failed to parse the _CRS object associated with a GED and hence could not determine the interrupt resources for the device.  he device will not be enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGedCrsFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver detected a resource pointer that is not naturally aligned to a 32 bit boundary. This has been automatically fixed and should not cause any issues.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResourceDescriptorError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid interrupt polarity/trigger in resource list
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver detected invalid interrupt polarity/trigger settings in a resource list. Only active high / edge_sensitive and active_low / level_senstive are allowed, so IRQ flags 0x00 and 0x09 are invalid.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResourceDescriptorError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver detected invalid DMA Transfer preference in a resource list. DMA Transfer preference 0x03 is invalid.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResourceDescriptorError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The APCI Transition To State (_TTS) control failed to be evaluated. This control is executated by the OS when a sleep transition occurs, however, failure to execute this generally is not an issue because firmware generally does not include it and not having it will not break transitioning to sleep states.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepEvalTts

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The APCI Prepare To State (_PTS) control failed to be evaluated. This control is executated by the OS when a sleep transition occurs, however, failure to execute this generally is not an issue and will not break the transitioning to sleep.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepEvalPts

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI does not support sleep state S
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver could not put the machine into the desired sleep state because the sleep state is not suppoted.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepStateNoSupport

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Hardware changed while hibernated, success doubtful
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The FACS hardware signature does not match the saved hardware signature. The kernel detected a change in the hardware so the resume from hibernate may not work or be possibly broken.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHibernateHwChange

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The maximum C state has been limited by the ACPI processor idle driver because of a known bug on this platform, for instance, going to a deeper C state can hang the machine. This can be overridden using the kernel parameter processor.max_cstate to set to a deeper C state if required.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIdleMaxCStateLimited

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI: processor limited to max C-state
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The maximum C state is less than the maxium allowed processor C states, so the CPU cannot go into a deep idle C state which means it is not optimally configured for power saving.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIdleMaxCStateLimited

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Battery Status (_BST) object is returning an invalid dischar or charge rate.  This can be either a negative 16 bit value or reporing 0 as 65536 because of an invalid calculation in the DSDT. The Linux ACPI battery driver has detected this firmware bug and attempted to work around it.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBstInvalidRate

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Err sending PCC mbox message. cmd
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI CPPC (Collaborative Processor Performance Control) driver attempted to send a command via the PCC mailbox but it failed to be sent. If this persists then the CPU freq drivers cannot control CPU performance using the _CPC ACPI tables.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCppcSendError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to find PCC communication channel
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI CPPC (Collaborative Processor Performance Control) driver could not find the requested PCC communication channel and so the CPU freq driver cannot control CPU performance via the _CPC ACPI tables.  This error occurs because the requested PCC communication channel is not defined in the ACPI Platform Communications Channel Table (PCCT).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPccFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No PCC subspace found for CPPC
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The PCC mailbox controller could not parse the ACPI Platform Communications Channel Table (PCCT) and find the PCC subspace communication region. The CPU freq driver cannot control CPU performance via the _CPC ACPI tables.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPccNoSubspace

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to ioremap PCC comm region mem
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI CPPC driver could not map the PCC subspace communication region, so the CPU freq driver cannot control CPU performance via the _CPC ACPI tables.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCppcIomapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MCFG (PCI Express memory mapped configuration space base address Description Table) cannot be parsed (due to an error in the table) and so PCIe memory mapped configuration has failed - expect PCIe devices not to function
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMcfgParseFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI evaluated a _CRS (Current Resource Setting) object to determine the start and end of of a PCI downsteam bus range and did not find the end address, so an end address of 0xff is being assumed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciCrsNoEndAddr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: failed to parse _CRS method, error code
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI tried to evaluateda _CRS (Current Resource Setting) object to determine PCI root resources, but the _CRS object could not be parsed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciCrsParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: found a zero length table .* parsing nfit
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI NVDIMM Firmware Interface Table (NFIT) header indicates a NFIT table has an invalid zero size and has been ignored. This will lead to a NVDIMM not being recognised by the system
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitZereSize

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI NVDIMM Firmware Interface Table (NFIT) Control Region Structure (DCR) is missing a System Physical Address (SPA), NFIT table is incorrect.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitDcrSpaError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI CMOS Real Time Clock (RTC) driver could not install a CMOS address space region handler (this allows CMOS read/writes). This failure has caused the ACPI CMOS RTC functionality to fail
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCmosRtcHandler

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI CMOS Real Time Clock (RTC) driver could not remove a CMOS address space region handler
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCmosRtcHandler

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The NUMA affinity configuration could not be determined because of errors in the ACPI SRAT table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratNotUsed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SRAT: Failed to mark hotplug range
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A hotpluggable memory range failed to be marked as hotpluggable. This generally occurs because the memory range is invalid and may overlap other memory regions.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratNotUsed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The NUMA affinity configuration could not be determined because the ACPI SRAT table header was the incorrect size.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratBadHeader

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The NUMA affinity configuration failed because the number of NUMA nodes is greater than the system defined hard limit of 1 << CONFIG_NODES_SHIFT.  The kernel config value for CONFIG_NODES_SHIFT needs to be increased.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratTooManyNodes

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SRAT: Failed to add memblk to node
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The per-architecture NUMA implementation was unable to add a NUMA memory block to the memory information data structures. This may occur if the node id is more than the maximum system configured number of NUMA nodes or all the allowed memory block ranges are used.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratMemBlkAddFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SLIT table looks invalid. Not used
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI SLIT (System Locality Distance Information) is not parsable or looks suspect, NUMA affinity cannot be configured.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSratMemBlkAddFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Embedded Controller (EC) driver has cleared the maximum number of pending ACPI _Q events that have accumulated in the EC before giving up. There may be more events pending that have not been cleared.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEcStaleEvents

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Embedded Controller (EC) driver failed to remove the EC address space handler.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEcHandlerRemoveFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Embedded Controller (EC) driver failed to remove the EC General Purpose Events (GPE) handler.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEcHandlerRemoveFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI debugger failed to parse the debug command
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDbgParseError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI error occurred getting an ACPI object reference. The reference class was not LOCAL, ARG or DEBUG.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRefClassInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: error while performing ARS to find poison:
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI NFIT (NVDIMM Firmware Interface Table) driver encountered an error while performing Address Range Scrub, so aborting initialization. ARS should never fail.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitArsPoison

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to set initial power state
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI fan driver was unable to update the fan device power state
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFanPowerState

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI debugger could not start a kernel thread to execute a debug command, most probably a kernel resource issue.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDbgThreadErr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Possible overflow of internal debugger buffer
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI debugger detected a error when evaluating an ACPI object or method, possibly a buffer overflow bug in the ACPI debugger.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDbgBufOverflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI debugger detected a error when evaluating an ACPI object or method.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDbgErr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI debugger could not parse the debugger command line (incorrect method arguments), most probably a user error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDbgCmdLine

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI debugger could not parse the debugger command line, most probably a user error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDbgCmdLine

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: (.*): Object must be a control method
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred disassembling an ACPI method, the namespace node was not an ACPI method.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjNotControlMethod

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred storing an ACPI object that was not the expected object type of ACPU buffer, integer, string or reference.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjStoreInvalidSrcType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot assign type .* to .*source must be type Pkg
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred storing an ACPI object that was not an ACPI package to a named object that was an ACPI package, this is not allowed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjStoreInvalidSrcType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI _FIT (Firmware Interface Table) method returned an object that was not the expected ACPI buffer object type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidFitObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution engine failed to store a value in an ACPI buffer or Package Element because the destination type was incorrect. The AML code in the firmware has a bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidDestinationType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI execution engine failed to store a value in an ACPI buffer or Package Element because the source type was incorrect. The AML code in the firmware has a bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidSourceType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Invoking one of the ACPI sleep states (S0 through to S5) failed to complete, either when trying to transition to the sleep state or returning from it.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to allocate an IRQ to a PCI link, possibly because of prevous IRQ allocations that have precedence. A workaround is to use kernel parameter pci=noacpi or acpi=off
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciLinkIrq

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI _BCL method (Query List of Brightness Control Levels Supported) returned a package that did not contain integer brightness levels
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBclInvalidData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver failed to merge the new NFIT from the _FIT object and resorted to using the previous (old) one instead
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitMergeError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver failed to evaluate the _FIT (Firmware Interface Table) object and no buffer was returned causing the NFIT notify event to fail
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFitEvalError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver failed to initialize, either because it was out of memory (unlikely) or the NVDIMM bus failed to register
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitInitFail

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver could not delete NFIT structure entries, this is funcionality is not currently supported by the ACPI NFIT driver
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitDeleteNoSupport

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver could not find an ACPI NFIT table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitNoTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver failed to make a NFIT DIMM mapping, exceeded the configured maximum allowed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitMappingsExceeded

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver could not map a NFIT DIMM, device is not enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitDimmNotFound

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver could not find a Device Control Region for a DIMM, device is not enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitNoDcr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver found multiple Device Control Regions for a DIMM, the first one found was selected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitDuplicateDcr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver could not evaluate the _STA object for an NFIT device, so it was not enabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitNoAddr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver could not find a child device with a specific address, so it was not enabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitNoAddr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver found an unknown NFIT structure type and cannot parse this particular NFIT structure
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfitInvalidType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI NFIT driver could not send a control message, output buffer overran
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNfit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI Table .* OEM:.* not found in RSDT/XSDT
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not found a specified ACPI table while evaluating table region operands. The table does not exist in the RSDT or XSDT table pointers
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableNotFound

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI was unable to load the DSDT, system will be missing AML from the Differentiated System Description Table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDSDTLoadFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI was unable to load an ACPI table, an ACPI exception occurred trying to load it
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableLoadFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI was unable to load one or more ACPI tables
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableLoadFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Internal ACPI error while trying to resolve an ACPI object node
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNodeError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not evaluate the fan state via the _FST object, perhaps this object does not exist or the object fails to evaluate correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetFanState

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not evaluate the fan state via the _FST object, one of the elements in the package may be an incorrect ACPI type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetFanStateBadData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not evaluate the fan device information via the _FIF object, the returned object was not an ACPI package as expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetFanInfo

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not evaluate the fan device information via the _FIF object, the returned package contained an element that was not of the correct ACPI type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetFanInfoBadData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not evaluate the fan device information via the _FPS object, the returned object was not an ACPI package as expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetFanDevInfo

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not evaluate the fan device information via the _FPS object, the returned package contained an element that was not of the correct ACPI type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetFanDevInfoBadData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI failed to create an ACPI fan device, there was not enough memory to allocate the device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFanNoMem

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not evaluate the fan state via the _FST object, one of the elements in the package may be an incorrect ACPI type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGetFanStateBadData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not acquire table length at
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI could not determine the length of an ACPI table. This can occur, for example, if the table cannot be mapped into memory or the header is corrupted or non-standard.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI table could not be installed because the checksum was invalid.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableInstall

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI method _STA (Status) failed to evaluate. This may cause some device drivers to not function as expected, for example, this error is reported when the ACPI battery status cannot be evaluated and so the battery updates will not function.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSTAEval

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Circular handler list in region object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Internal corruption to the ACPI region handler list has occurred and ACPI has detected this issue while detaching a region and aborted an infinite loop while attempting to traverse the list. This has been known to occur with some firmware tripping a possible internal ACPI bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCircularList

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Circular region list in address handler object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Internal corruption to the ACPI region handler list has occurred and ACPI has detected this issue during deletion of a region object and aborted an infinite loop while attempting to traverse the list. This has been known to occur with some firmware tripping a possible internal ACPI bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCircularList

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Path has too many parent prefixes.*reached beyond root node
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The firmware specified an ACPI path using too many parent ^ prefixes and reached a point where thare are no parent nodes in the hierarchy and so the referenced object could not be found.  The kernel cannot find the named object because of this bug in the firmware and this may lead to broken or misbehaving behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPathTooManyParentPrefixes

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel parameter mem=nopentium (to disable 4MB pages) was ignored as it only applies to 32 bit x86 systems.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogE8320BiosKernelParameter

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: apm: Could not register misc device
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: APM misc device could not be registered. However, the driver can work without this, but userspace cannot control it.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosApmMiscDevice

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not allocate an object descriptor
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was unable to allocate an object descriptor from the ACPI global operand cache, see acpi_ut_allocate_object_desc_dbg().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAllocObjDescriptor

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred attempting to get an ACPI handle from a kernel device structure.  The handle appears to be corrupt and invalid, so the unbinding of links to the device could not be actioned. See acpi_unbind_one(). This could be due to an ACPI kernel bug or a genenal memory corruption issue.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHandleCorrupt

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to create a sysfs link on a firmware node.  Depending on the firmware node this may impede userspace from interfacing with the firmware.  See acpi_bind_one().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSysfsCreateLinkFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An out of memory error occurred attempting to allocate resources while creating a platform device for an ACPI device node.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPlatformDeviceNoMemory

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI initialization failed to create the acpi_kobj kobject and so it won't appear in /sys/firmware. This may cause some user space applications difficulties if this is not created and populated. See acpi_init().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSysfsFirmwareNotCreated

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Error creating sysfs interface for device
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred when adding a new ACPI device and the sysfs interface could not be created.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSysfsDeviceInterfaceFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred when adding a new ACPI device, the device registration failed. See acpi_device_add().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpi

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred while trying to evaluate an ACPI reference. An element in the package had a NULL reference handle.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullReferenceInPackage

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred while trying to extract a ACPI package, got an ACPI reference in a package element, but was expecting a different type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidPackageElement

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred while trying to extract a ACPI package, got a string or a buffer in a package element, but was expecting a different type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidPackageElement

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred while trying to extract a ACPI package, got an integer in a package element, but was expecting a different type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidPackageElement

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Format specifies more objects.*than exist in package
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred while trying to extract an ACPI package, the format specifier specifies more object than actually exist in the package. See acpi_extract_package().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadFormatSpecifier

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Deprecated procfs I/F for AC is loaded, please retry with CONFIG_ACPI_PROCFS_POWER cleared
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Using an old procfs interface for ACPI AC Adapter, this occurs if CONFIG_ACPI_PROCFS_POWER is enabled. This should be disabled for kernels > 2.6.37.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDeprecatedProcfsInterface

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Deprecated procfs I/F for battery is loaded, please retry with CONFIG_ACPI_PROCFS_POWER cleared
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Using an old procfs interface for ACPI battery, this occurs if CONFIG_ACPI_PROCFS_POWER is enabled. This should be disabled for kernels > 2.6.37.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDeprecatedProcfsInterface

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Deprecated procfs I/F for SBS is loaded, please retry with CONFIG_ACPI_PROCFS_POWER cleared
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Using an old procfs interface for ACPI battery, this occurs if CONFIG_ACPI_PROCFS_POWER is enabled. This should be disabled for kernels > 2.6.37.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDeprecatedProcfsInterface

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This is an internal ACPI driver error, an unknown processor throttling notifier event has been passed to acpi_processor_throttling_notifier().  This error is very unlikely and is an ACPI driver bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnkownCpuThrottleNotifier

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to create genetlink family for ACPI event
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An internel kernel error occurred during  ACPI driver genetic link initialization. See acpi_event_genetlink_init() in drivers/acpi/event.c for more information.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGenetlinkInitFail

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Can not change Invalid GPE/Fixed Event status
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI_EVENT_FLAG_HANDLE bit in the event status was not set which is invalid, aborting setting a GPE or Fixed Event counter.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidStatus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI table had more sub-table entries than expected, the extra entries were ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableLargerThanExpected

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI object evaluation failed because the caller requested a return value but the return buffer length was zero which is not enough to store the return value.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalZeroBufferLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred evaluating an ACPI _PRS IRQ resource, the resource was NULL or the interrupt count was zero.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBlankPrsIrqResource

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred evaluating an ACPI _CRS IRQ resource, the resource was NULL or the interrupt count was zero.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBlankCrsIrqResource

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI _CRS reported that a link should be using a specific IRQ, however a different IRQ is being used for the PCI link and _CRS has been ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCrsIgnoredForPciLinkIrq

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This error only occurs in ACPI strict mode. An interrupt specified by _CRS was not found in the _PRS, so a PCI interrupt is chosen from the last entry of the _PRS list.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCrsNotInPrs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Your BIOS is broken and requested that x2apic be disabled
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The DMAR DMAR_X2APIC_OPT_OUT bit was set so the firmware requested that the x2apic should be disabled leading to decreased system performance.  The firmware opt out can be overridden using the intremap=no_x2apic_optout kernel parameter.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogSratEntryUnsupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel detected an entry in the ACPI System Resource Affinity Table (SRAT) that was not recognised. Processor local APIC/SAPIC affinity (0), Memory affinity (1) and Processory local x2APIC affinity (2) are only supported.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogSratEntryUnsupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This warning occurs because NUMA x2apic affinity is not enabled. Kernel config CONFIG_ACPI_NUMA must be enabled to avoid this warning.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogSratx2apicUnsupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to change the throttling state to one that is outside the range of T-states as provided by the Throttling Supported States _TSS package. The last (and hence lowest performance) state has been selected instead.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogTstateLimitExceeded

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The FADT Duty Cycle Offset and Duty Cycle Width is > 4, which means there are more than the maximum allowed 16 processor throttling states so throttling will be be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogTooManyThrottlingStates

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to extract an ACPI package but found that the ACPI object was either NULL or was not a package or was a package that had zero elements.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogInvalidPackageArgument

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to extract an ACPI package but found that the format was NULL or the format pointer was NULL or the format length was less than 1.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogInvalidFormatArgument

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to extract an ACPI package but found that the destination buffer was NULL.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogInvalidBufferArgument

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Limiting number of power states to max
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI C states object (_CST) contains more C states than ACPI supports and so the kernal has had to limit this.  To enable more C states, one must increase the Kernal ACPI macro ACPI_PROCESSOR_MAX_POWER.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogLimitPowerStates

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Duplicate ACPI video bus devices for the same VGA controller
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI video driver has found a duplicate ACPI video bus device for the same VGA controller.  If the current driver does not work, one can try to work around this using the video.allow_duplicates=1 kernel parameter.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogDuplicateACPIVideoBus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: TSC doesn't count with P0 frequency
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The AMD processor has the x86 constant TSC feature enabled but the firmware has not set bit 24 of the MSR MSR_K7_HWCR and so the processor TSC does not count in the P0 frequenct level. This is a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAmdTscP0FreqNoCount

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS strings suggest APM bugs, disabling power status reporting
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The firmware is known to have broken Advanced Power Management (APM), so APM has been disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogApmBiosBroken

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS strings suggest APM reports battery life in minutes and wrong byte order
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The firmware is known to report the battery life in minutes in the wrong byte order, so the kernel has detected this and will work around the firmware bug.  This is known to occur on many Sony laptops.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogApmMinuteSwapBytes

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The machine has had ACPI support disabled because either the firmware is way too old, or it is known to have broken or bad ACPI support. One can try to override this with the acpi=force kernel parameter, but the machine may still hang or not work correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDisabled

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has been forced to enabled ACPI. This is sometimes required because ACPI support has been disabled because the firmware is too old or was blocklisted because it has known ACPI issues.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiForceOverride

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to evaluate the ACPI Passive List (_PSL) object for a particular thermal zone but this failed. The passive cooling for that particular thermal zone has been invalidated.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogInvalidPassiveThreshold

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The firmware critical trip point has been overridden using the kernel critical trip point kernel parameter crt.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogCriticalThreshold

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Multiple APIC Description Table (MADT) contains an entry that has an unknown MADT header type. This will be igored, but it does suggest a broken or buggyy ACPI MADT.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogMadtEntryUnsupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An internal ACPI driver bug has occurred. acpi_bus_init_irq has detected an unknown interrupt routing model in acpi_irq_model. This most probably is a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIrqModelUnknown

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel was unable to map the ACPI BOOT table and hence unable to determine the port to set the Simple Boot Flag.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBootTableNotMapped

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: DMAR: Recommended TLB entries for ISOCH unit is 16; your BIOS set
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The recommended number of TLB entries for the ISOCH DMAR unit should be 16, hoever the firmware has misconfigured this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogDmarTlbEntriesMisconfigured

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot transition to non-D0 state from D3
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI cannot transition a device from a D3 state to a non-D0 state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiD0TransitionFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot set device to a higher-powered state than parent
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI cannot transition a device to a higher power state to that of the parent device.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHigherPowerStateThanParent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI cannot transition a device to a different power state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPowerStateTransitionFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Possible Resource Settings (_PRS) object returned an invalid IRQ mapping from a PCI interrupt pin to the interrupt input of an interrupt controller.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidPrsIrq

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: firmware reports .*:.*:.* PCI INT .* connected to .*; changing to
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has detected a PCI interrupt configuration than needed to be quirked to make it work correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciIntRemap

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel could not find an IOAPIC that manages the Global System Interrupt (GSI), so no IOAPIC will be configured with that GSI.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNoIoapicForGsi

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Test caused CPU temperature above critical threshold. The CPU has been throttled to run slower because of over-heating above the critical threshold. CPU throttling will be turned off once the CPU has cooled sufficiently.  Frequent throttling may indicate poor thermal design on the machine.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogThermalOverrun

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A Pentium class Intel CPU has had a thermal machine check exception caused by hot CPU.  If this persists it may indicate poor thermal design on the machine.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogThermalOverrun

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The boot processor is not enumerated!
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosBootCpuNotEnumerated

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Hotplug _HPP method failed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHppMethodFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Hotplug OSHP method failed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotplugOshpMethodFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Hotplug _BBN method is missing
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHotPlugBbnMissing

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: _PSD domain information is corrupt!
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPsdParsingError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Wrong _BBN value, reboot and use option 'pci=noacpi'
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS has wrong _BBN value, which will make PCI root bridge have wrong bus number
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiWrongBbnValue

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI.*apic on CPU.* stops in C2
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The local apic timer incorrectly stops during C2 idle state.The ACPI specification forbids this and Linux needs the local APIC timer to work. The most likely cause of this is that the firmware uses a hardware C3 or C4 state that is mapped to the ACPI C2 state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiApicStopsInC2

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to request resources for .* on irqchip
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: BIOS may not set up a specific pin or a GPIO to be an IRQ. This can cause a device, such as a touchscreen, that depends on this IRQ to fail.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosIrqRequestFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel detected an irq storm. This is most probably an IRQ routing bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosIrqRoutingBug

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI fixed event could not be enabled. This can affect fixed events such as the power management timer, power button, sleep button, RTC alarm, wake status, system bus master request or the global release lock status.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEventEnableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI fixed event could not be disabled. This can affect fixed events such as the power management timer, power button, sleep button, RTC alarm, wake status, system bus master request or the global release lock status.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEventDisableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter attempted to convert or repair a return object of an unexpected type, however a fatal error occurred during the conversion.  Undefined AML execution behaviour may occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjConvertFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: MMIO size insufficient to access LTR
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Intel Lynxpoint Low Power Subsystem have a set of MMIO mapped registers that provide access to the LTR (Latency Tolerance Reporting).  However, the MMIO size is smaller than expected. The corresponding I/O resource for this is incorrect, it should have a resource size set to a minimum of 24 bytes.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiLpssMmioSizeTooSmall

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to install a notify handler for the ACPI video driver. The ACPI video driver cannot handle notify events to change brightness levels or turn the display on/off.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNotifyHandlerInstallFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to remove a notify handler for the ACPI video driver. This is most probably an internal kernel issue.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNotifyHandlerRemoveFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to register the ACPI buse type.  This is not deemed to be fatal, but it is a kernel error that should be investigated. See acpi_scan_init().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiScanBusTypeRegisterFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI platform clocks failed to initialize making the creation of the platform device for the ACPI device node fail. See acpi_create_platform_device() and acpi_create_platform_clks().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPlatformClockCreateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to register the ACPI device node.  platform_device_register_full() failed which makes the platform device creation fail.  See platform_device_register_full() and acpi_create_platform_device().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPlatformDeviceCreateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: cannot add bridge to acpi list
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI bus scan failed and so a root bridge hotplug insertion failed.  See handle_root_bridge_insertion().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRootBridgeAddFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI object find and evaluate has failed, the return object requested does not match the requested type.  This is most probably a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIncorrectReturnType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Attempted to decode an ACPI field definition failed because the firmware attempted to use an unknown access type.  Only byte, word, dword, qword and 'any' access types are allowed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUknownFieldAccessType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Construction of an object and connecting it to a parent node failed because a region node was unexpectedly NULL. See acpi_ex_prep_field_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullRegionNode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Null Index Object during field prep
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Construction of an object and connecting it to a parent node failed for a local index field. See acpi_ex_prep_field_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullIndexObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, there is no object attached to the given node. See acpi_ex_resolve_node_to_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNoObjectAttachedToNode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, the source object was not an ACPI package as expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectNotPackage

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, the source object was not an ACPI buffer as expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectNotBuffer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, the source object was not an ACPI string as expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectNotString

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, the source object was not an ACPI integer as expected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectNotInteger

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, the source object was an ACPI ANY type and so there is no object associated with it.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUntypedEntry

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, the source object reference class must be a table, refof or index reference class.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnsupportedReferenceType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI namespace node to a valued object, the source object was an unknown type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownObjectType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred turning an ACPI internal name into an external (printable) form. The required length exceeded the intenral name length, causing a bounds error.  See acpi_ns_externalize_name().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidInternalName

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid zero length descriptor in resource list
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred turning an ACPI resource list into a byte stream of resources.  The resource length was zero, which is an illegal length.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidZeroLengthDescriptor

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: is not an ACPI Operand object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An internal ACPI error occurred freeing an ACPI object or adding it to the object cache. The descriptor type of the given object was not a descriptor type operand.  See acpi_ut_delete_object_desc().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNotOperandObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot convert to external object - unsupported Reference Class .* in object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An internal ACPI error occurred getting the size of a simple ACPI object. A local reference object with a reference class that was not a refclass name class is not currently supported (such as locals and args) in the ACPI driver and may need implementing. See acpi_ut_get_simple_object_size().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnsupportedReferenceClass

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot convert to external object - unsupported type .* in object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An internal ACPI error occurred getting the size of a simple ACPI object, the object was of a type that is not supported.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnsupportedType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred getting the node associated with a local or an arg. The local index for the refclass local type was greather than ACPI_METHOD_MAX_LOCAL.  See acpi_ds_method_data_get_node().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiLocalIndexInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred getting the node associated with a local or an arg. The arg index for the refclass arg type was greather than ACPI_NETHOD_MAX_ARG.  See acpi_ds_method_data_get_node().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiArgIndexInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred getting the node associated with a local or an arg. The given type is not a refclass local or refclass arg type. See acpi_ds_method_data_get_node().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTypeInvalid
