firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred retrieving the value of a selected Arg or Local for a method, the descriptor pointer was NULL. See acpi_ds_method_data_get_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullObjectDescriptorPtr

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred retrieving the value of a selected Arg or Local for a method, an argument to the method was not initialised. This is probably a firmware bug. See also acpi_ds_method_data_get_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnitializedArg

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred retrieving the value of a selected Arg or Local for a method. This is probably a firmware bug. See also acpi_ds_method_data_get_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNotArgLocalOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Field .* access width .* too large for region
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An access type is larger than a region, for example, where a region is one byte in length and a field of dword access is specified.  This is a bug in the firmware and the access to the region fails. This can lead to unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldAccessWidthTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Field .* Base.*Offset.*Width .* is beyond end of region
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An access exceeds the region length, in this case the base + offset + access width is larger than the region size.  For example, this could be a dword access one byte from the end of region.  This is a bug in the firmware and the access to the region fails. This can lead to unexpected behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldEndOfRegion

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An access (read or write) to an operation region has been attempted and a region for this has not been implemented, this may need to be implemented to provide the expected behaviour. See acpi_ex_access_region().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRegionNotImplemented

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An access (read or write) to an operation region has been attempted and a region handler for this has not been implemented, this may need to be implemented to provide the expected behaviour. See acpi_ex_access_region().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiKlogRegionNoHandler

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A write of a value larger than the maximum value that can fit into a register has be detected. The bit length of the field is not wide enough or the value is larger than expected.  This is normally a bug in the firmware. See acpi_ex_register_overflow().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIndexValueOverflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Wrong object type in field I/O
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A read or write of a data to an I/O field failed. The object is of the wrong type. See acpi_ex_field_datum_io().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiWrongObjectType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to apply a field update rule to a field write failed because the update rule was unknown. See acpi_ex_write_with_update_rule().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUknownUpdateRuleValue

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Field size .* is too large for buffer
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to extract the current value of a given field failed because the field size was too large for the given buffer.  See acpi_ex_extract_from_field().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldSizeTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: GPE0 block .* overlaps the GPE1 block .* Ignoring GPE1
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred initializing the GPE data structures, the GPE0/GPE1 blocks overlap each other.  This is normally a bug in the ACPI FADT GPE block address config.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpe0BlockOverlapsGpe1Block

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Maximum GPE number from FADT is too large: 0x
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: There were more than 255 GPEs specified in the FADT. The ACPI driver only supports a maximum of 255 GPEs.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMaxGpeTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: For GPE 0x.* found both _L.* and _E.* methods
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A GPE has a level _Lxx and an edge _Exx method associated with it, which is incorrect, it should have one or the other but not both.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeFoundMultipleMethods

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot acquire Mutex .* null thread info
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to acquire an ACPI AML mutex failed, the caller must have a valid thread state structure.  This is an internal ACPICA driver bug. See acpi_ex_acquire_mutex().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMutexAcquireFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot acquire Mutex \[.*\], current SyncLevel is too large
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI mutex was not acquired because the sync level was too large. The per-thread sync level must be less or equal to the sync level of the method being executed.  This error occurs because the interpreter attempted to avoid possible deadlocks. See acpi_ex_acquire_mutex().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMutexAcquireFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI mutex was not already previously acquired, so it cannot be released.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMutexReleaseFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot release Mutex .* null thread info
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI mutex could not be released, the thread ID was null and not valid. This maybe an internal ACPICA bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMutexReleaseFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Thread .* cannot release Mutex .* acquired by thread
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI mutex is already owned but the thread making the mutex release is not the owner, so the release was rejected.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMutexReleaseFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot release Mutex .* SyncLevel mismatch: mutex .* current
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI mutex could not be released, the sync level of the mutex must be equal to that of the current sync level. Attempting to release a mutex of a different level means that the mutex ordering rule has been violated.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMutexReleaseFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not transition to ACPI mode
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A request to transfer a system into ACPI mode has failed. This could be because the ACPI FADT does not have SMI_CMD defined, or that the FADT ACPI_ENABLE and ACPI_DISABLE flags are both zero, or a SMI command failed to work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAcpiModeTransitionFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Hardware did not enter ACPI mode
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Could not transfer a system into the ACPI mode. A SMI command was issued however the system failed to transition to the ACPI mode after 3 seconds of waiting. Perhaps SMIs are broken or that the firmware cannot transition the machine to ACPI mode.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAcpiModeNotEntered

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not exit ACPI mode to legacy mode
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A request to transfer a system into legacy BIOS mode has failed. This could be because the ACPI FADT does not have SMI_CMD defined, or that the FADT ACPI_ENABLE and ACPI_DISABLE flags are both zero, or a SMI command failed to work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAcpiModeToLegacyModeFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Target is not a Reference or Constant object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to store an ACPI value into a location failed because the target is not a reference or a constat object. See acpi_ex_store().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTargetNotRefOrConstantObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI store op-code failed to execute because the an unknown reference class type was used. The store operation will fail to execute leading to undefined behaviour. This is possibly an AML compiler bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownRefClass

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Source must be Integer/Buffer/String type, not
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to store an ACPI object into an indexed buffer or package element failed because the source type is invalid. See acpi_ex_store_object_to_index().  This is most likely a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadSourceType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Target is not a Package or BufferField
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to store an ACPI object into an indexed buffer or package element failed beacause the targe type is not a package or a buffer field.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTargetNotPackageOrBufferField

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No pointer back to namespace node in buffer object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to get a buffer length and initializer byte list failed because there was no pointer that referenced back to the name space node in the given buffer object.  See acpi_ds_get_buffer_arguments().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadPointeInBufferObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No pointer back to namespace node in package
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to get a buffer length and initializer byte list failed because there was no pointer that referenced back to the name space node in the given package.  See acpi_ds_get_package_arguments().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadPointerInPackage

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI fixed event could not be disabled, acpi_disable_event() failed to disable it.  See acpi_ev_terminate().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFixedEventDisableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI SCI handler could not be removed. See acpi_ev_terminate().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSciHandlerRemoveFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not remove Global Lock handler
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Global Lock Handler could not be removed. See acpi_ev_terminate().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalLockHandlerRemoveFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI resource descriptor failed a validation check, the bus type field for a serial bus resource descriptor is invalid. See acpi_ut_validate_resource().  This appears to be a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadSerialBusResourceDescriptor

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid resource descriptor length: Type 0x.*, Length 0x.* MinLength 0x.*
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI resource descriptor failed a validation check, the length of the resource descriptor is invalid. See acpi_ut_validate_resource().  This appears to be a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidResourceDescriptorLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to pop an object off the ACPI walk result stack, no results on the stack. This is an internal ACPICA bug and should not occur, see acpi_ds_result_pop().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackNoResults

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No result state for result stack
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to pop an object off the ACPI walk result stack, no result state on the stack. This is an internal ACPICA bug and should not occur, see acpi_ds_result_pop().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackNoState

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to pop an object off the ACPI walk result stack, the result stack is NULL (empty). This is normally triggered by buggy firmware attempting to pop values off the stack when it is empty.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStatckEmpty

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No result objects on result stack, State=
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to pop an object off the ACPI walk result stack, there were no result objects on the result stack.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStatckNoResultObjects

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push an object onto the current ACPI result stack, the result stack is full up. This is an internal ACPICA bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackFull

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to extend the result stack
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push an object onto the current ACPI result stack, the stack could not be extended.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackExtendFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No free elements in result stack
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push an object onto the current ACPI result stack, there are no free element slots in the stack. This is an internal ACPICA bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackNoFreeElements

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No result stack frame during push
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push an object onto the current ACPI result stack, there appears to be no results stack to push the object onto. This is an internal ACPICA bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackPushNoFrame

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push an object onto the current ACPI result stack, the object is NULL.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackNullObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push an object onto the ACPI walk_state result stack. The stack has overflowed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackOverflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to pop an object off the ACPI walk_state result stack. The result stack had insufficient objects on it to pop off.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResultStackSizeInsufficient

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to push an object onto the walk state object/operand stack, a maximum of 8 operands are allowed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectStackOverflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to pop an object from the walk state object/operand stack, there were no operands left on the stack.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjectStackUnderflow

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: is not a valid walk state
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to delete an ACPI walk state, the given walk state is not an ACPI walk state type.  This is an internal ACPICA bug. see acpi_ds_delete_walk_state().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiWalkStateInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: walk still has a scope list
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to delete an ACPI walk state, the walk state has an open scope list.  This is an internal ACPICA bug. See acpi_ds_delete_walk_state().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiWalkStateHasScopeList

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Target of Create Field is not a Buffer object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to initialise an ACPI buffer field, the target of the Create Field op is not a buffer object. This is a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTargetNotBufferObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to initialise an ACPI buffer field, the destination is not an ACPI name space node. This is a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDestinationNotNameSpaceNode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Attempt to CreateField of length zero
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to initialise an ACPI buffer field, CreateField used with a zero field length which is illegal. This is a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiZeroLengthCreateField

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to initialise an ACPI buffer field, was expecting a CreateField, CreateBitField, CreateByteField, CreateWordField, CreateDWordField or a CreateQWordField opcode, but got a different AML opcode instead.  This is a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUknownFieldCreationOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to initialise an ACPI buffer field, the field exceeded the buffer size provided. This is a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldExceedsBuffer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to get buffer field Buffer and Index, could not resolve operands. A call to acpi_ex_resolve_operands() failed and returned an error status code. See acpi_ds_eval_buffer_field_operands().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadOperand

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No Sleep State object returned from
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An evaluation of the _Sx namespace object containing register values for the sleep state failed. It is entirely possible that the _Sx is broken in the firmware.  See also acpi_get_sleep_type_data():
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNoSleepStateObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Sleep State return object is not a Package
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An evaluation of the _Sx namespace object containing register values for the sleep state failed.  The kernel was expecting an ACPI package to be returned, but some different type was returned instead.  The ACPI firmware object _Sx is buggy.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepStateObjectNotPackage

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The exception comes from kernel cannot find _S1 namespace object that contains the register values for the sleep state when kernel would like to setup all the sleep state information. This means that the kernel does not know how to enter the S1 sleep state, however, it should not be a problem if the S1 sleep state isn't supported intentionally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepStateEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The exception comes from kernel cannot find _S2 namespace object that contains the register values for the sleep state when kernel would like to setup all the sleep state information. This means that the kernel does not know how to enter the S2 sleep state, however, it should not be a problem if the S2 sleep state isn't supported intentionally.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepStateEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to evaluate _Sx namespace object that contains the register values for the sleep state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepStateEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Resize of Root Table Array is not allowed
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to resize the ACPI Root Table Array failed because the ACPI global root table flag ACPI_ROOT_ALLOW_RESIZE is not set.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRootTableArrayResize

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not allocate new root table array
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to allocate memory for the root table array.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRootTableArrayAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Destination type should be one of Integer, Buffer Field, Local Bank Field, Local Index Field, String or Buffer.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadDestinationType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unknown Target type ID 0x.* AmlOpcode 0x.* DestType
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An unknown target type was found in attempting to perform implicit type conversion.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownTargetTypeId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SMBus/IPMI/GenericSerialBus write requires Buffer, found type
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A SMBus, IPMI or GenericSerialBus write to a named field required a buffer to write into, but got a different type instead.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiWriteRequiresBuffer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SMBus/IPMI/GenericSerialBus write requires Buffer of length .*, found length
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A write buffer was too small.  SMBus, IPMI and GenericSerialBus writes require a buffer of size 34, 66 and 34 bytes respectively.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiWriteBufferSize

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not acquire AML Interpreter mutex
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The AML interpreter mutex could not be acquired when entering the interpreter execution region.  This is a fatal system error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlMutexAcquireFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An invalid descriptor type was found while obtaining a reference to a target object.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidDescriptorType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter failed to concatenate two objects of the same type because one or more of the types was an invalid object type. Expected types are ACPI_TYPE_INTEGER, ACPI_TYPE_STRING, ACPI_TYPE_BUFFER.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiConcatenateInvalidObjectType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the node, target name or return node pointers were NULL when attempting to search for a name segment in a single namespace level, see acpi_ns_search_and_enter().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNameSpaceNullParameter

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not allocate the GpeRegisterInfo table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: General Purpose Events will fail to work because the table could not be allocated.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeRegisterInfoAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not allocate the GpeEventInfo table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: General Purpose Events will fail to work because the table could not be allocated.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeEventInfoAllocFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A hardware I/O request failed because the requested bit width of the I/O operation was not 8, 16 or 32 bits wide.  Undefined behaviour may occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadBitWidth

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A hardware I/O port access was above the 64K 16 bit port address space. This is illegal and not allowed. Undefined behaviour may occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIllegalIoPortAddressLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create a linked list of PCI interrupt descriptions, the given list did not contain a sub-package. See acpi_rs_create_pci_routing_table().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRoutingTableSubPackageRequired

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Need package of length 4, found length
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create a linked list of PCI interrupt descriptions, a sub-package had an incorrect package length. See acpi_rs_create_pci_routing_table().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRoutingTableBadPackageLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create a linked list of PCI interrupt descriptions, a sub-package Address (element 0) was not an Integer type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRoutingTableBadPackageAddressType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create a linked list of PCI interrupt descriptions, a sub-package Pin (element 1) was not an Integer type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRoutingTableBadPackagePinType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create a linked list of PCI interrupt descriptions, a sub-package SourceName (element 2) local reference was not an reference class name type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRoutingTableBadPackageSourceNameRefType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create a linked list of PCI interrupt descriptions, a sub-package SourceName (element 2) was not a local reference, Integer or String type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRoutingTableBadPackageSourceNameType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create a linked list of PCI interrupt descriptions, a sub-package SourceIndex (element 3) was not an Integer type
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciRoutingTableBadSourceIndexType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Control Method .* has no attached object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An internal ACPICA error has occurred while attempting to get the next name, see acpi_ps_get_next_namepath(). This information is critical for parsing to continue correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiControlMethodNoAttachedObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred in getting the next simple argument was expecting one of byte data, work data, dword data, qword data, char list, name or namestring, see acpi_ps_get_next_simple_arg().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpi

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred in getting the result of a predicate evaluation, a NULL operand object was found, which is unexpected. See acpi_ds_get_predicate_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullPredicateObjDesc

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The result of a predicate evaluation should be an integer but it was not. This is an unexpected error. See acpi_ds_get_predicate_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadPredicateEvalResult

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Caught an unexpected opcode type, see acpi_ds_exec_end_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUndefinedOpCodeType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Caught an unexpected unimplemented opcode, see see acpi_ds_exec_end_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnimplementedOpCode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred during Name Space initialisation, a predefined name could not be overridden. This only occurs if the initial value is NULL or the value string is NULL.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNameSpaceOverrideFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred during Name Space initialisation, a predefined name initial value is of an unsupported type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNameSpaceOverrideBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A scope node is not a namespace node, this is an internal ACPICA error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNameSpaceNotNameSpaceNode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: ACPI path has too many parent prefixes (^) - reached beyond root node
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI path has too many parent prefixes and has fallen outside the root node.  This is a bug in the firmware.  The Name Space lookup on the ACPI path cannot be found.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPathTooManyParentPrefixes

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not construct external pathname; index=.*, size=.*, Path=.*
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Expected a zero index to a name buffer.  See acpi_ns_build_external_path().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiExternalPathNameConstructFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid Namespace Node .* while traversing namespace
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI namespace node descriptor type was not the expected ACPI_DESC_TYPE_NAMED type. Could not get the pathname length, see acpi_ns_get_pathname_length().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidNameSpaceNodeType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unsupported object type, cannot convert to external object:
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to copy a simple internal ACPI object to an external ACPI object, unknown internal object type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUtCopyBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unsupported object type, cannot convert to internal object:
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to copy a simple external ACPI object to an internal ACPI object, unknown external object type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUtCopyBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to copy an internal ACPI package object to another internal ACPI package object, out of memory.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPackageAllocFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI object type did not match the expected type, expected an ACPI Region type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCheckObjectTypeFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI object type did not match the expected type.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCheckObjectTypeFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An internal ACPICA error occurred resolving operands - the ACPICA stack is either NULL or contains a NULL entry. This should not happen.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullStackEntry

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred trying to convert multiple input operands to the types required by the target operator, see acpi_ex_resolve_operands(), the internal ACPI operand object type was not correct.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBadOperandObjectType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred in resolving operands, required an Integer, String or Buffer type, got a different type instead.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResolveOpBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: BIOS setup is configured to enable IOMMU, but BIOS lacks IVRS table that is describing which is the address of IOMMU
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAmdIommuNoIVRS

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to read/write to IOMMU perf counter
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: AMD IOMMU performance counter is inaccessible and public specifications do not have information on how it should be supported
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAmdIommuPCNotSupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred in resolving operands, required an Integer, String, Package or Reference type (normally for a size_of operator), got a different type instead.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResolveOpBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred in resolving operands, required a Buffer, String or Package type, got a different type instead.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResolveOpBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred in resolving operands, required a Region or Buffer type, got a different type instead.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResolveOpBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred in resolving operands, required an Integer, Buffer, String, Package or Dbd type for a Store() operator, got a different type instead.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResolveOpBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to resolve an ACPI operand, bad descriptor; expecting either an ACPI_DESC_TYPE_NAMED or ACPI_DESC_TYPE_OPERAND descriptor.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidDescriptor

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Internal error in acpi_ex_resolve_operands() - found an unknown type, this should not occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResolveOpBadArgType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to dispatch an address space or operation region access failed because the region has never been initialised but it does not have an address space setup function.  This is a ACPI or kernel address space handler bug.  Access to the address space or operation region will fail with undefined behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRegionHanderNoInit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: The DSDT has been corrupted or replaced - old, new headers below
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Some firmware corrupts the DSDT or installs a bad new DSDT, so a workaround is to copy the DSDT. Booting with kernel parameter acpi=copy_dsdt may fix this issue.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDsdtCorruptOrReplaced

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not copy DSDT of length 0x
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to copy DSDT to local memory. Some firmware corrupts the DSDT or installs a bad new DSDT, so a workaround is to copy the DSDT.  However, the table allocation failed, which means ACPI initialisation had failed, so ACPI support is disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDsdtCopyFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Null physical address for ACPI table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to install an ACPI table has failed because the physical address of the table is NULL, which is incorrect.  This could lead to ACPI failing to initialize and perhaps ACPI support being disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableNullPhysicalAddress

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not map memory for table .* at
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI table could not me mapped into memory and was not added to the ACPI root table list.  This may lead to broken functionality.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableMemoryMapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI attempted to attach an ACPI object with a NULL parent node, see acpi_ns_attach_object().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAttachNullParentNode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Null object, but type not ACPI_TYPE_ANY
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI attempted to attach a NULL ACPI object with a type that was not ACPI_TYPE_ANY, see acpi_ns_attach_object().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAttachNullObjectBadType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to attach an object with an ACPI node failed because the node was not a name handle type. This is probably an internal ACPI error. See acpi_ns_attach_object().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidHandle

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Bit offset within field too large.*0xFFFFFFFF
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A named field has a bit offset that is greater than the 32 bit field offset limit. An AML_INT_RESERVEDFIELD_OP 0x0031 was ignored because of the bit offset error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldOffsetTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A named field has a bit offset that is greater than the 32 bit field offset limit. An AML_INT_NAMEDFIELD_OP 0x0030 was ignored because of the bit offset error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldOffsetTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An invalid opcode was found while parsing a field list. This is invariable due to buggy firmware.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFieldListInvalidOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Attempt to dereference an Index to NULL package element Idx=
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred attempting to retrieve a value from an internal ACPI object. A NULL object descriptor indicates an uninitialized element in an ACPI package, and hence it cannot be deferenced. Could not retrieve a value from an internal ACPI object. See acpi_ex_resolve_object_to_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNullPackageElementDereference

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI reference was found that did not point to a namespace node. Failed to resolve. See acpi_ex_resolve_multiple().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNotNamespaceNode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI_REFCLASS_INDEX has an unknown target type. Should be a buffer field or a package. Could not retrieve a value from an internal ACPI object. See acpi_ex_resolve_object_to_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnkownTargetType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI object type was not a known reference type. Could not retrieve a value from an internal ACPI object. See acpi_ex_resolve_object_to_value().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownReferenceType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A table or method owner ID allocation was attempted but the owner ID already exists.  The allocation has failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOwnerIdAlreadyExists

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not allocate new OwnerId (255 max), AE_OWNER_ID_LIMIT
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A table or method owner ID allocation failed because all owner IDs (maximum of 255) are in use. This only happens if there are very deep nestings of invoked control methods or there is an ACPI bug where owner IDs are not being released.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNoFreeOwnerIds

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to release an owner ID failed because the owner ID is invalud. Only owner IDs 1 to 255 are allowed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidOwnerId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to release an owner ID failed because the owner ID is not already allocated. This is a double-release error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOwnerIdDoubleRelease

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An invalid AML opcode in the input stream has been encountered. This will be skipped. This normally indicates buggy firmware.  Undefined behaviour may occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Expecting bytelist, found AML opcode 0x.* in op
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred translating a parser object to an equivalent namespace object. This occurs when evaluating a named buffer object such as Name(xxxx, Buffer) and the buffer does not contain an AML opcode bytelist.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiByteListExpected

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred initializing a namespace object from a parser op. The return type was an Integer however the opcode type was not a Zero op, One op, Ones op or Revision op. See acpi_ds_init_object_from_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownConstantOpcode

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred initializing a namespace object from a parser op. The return type was an unknown Integer type. See acpi_ds_init_object_from_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownIntegerType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unimplemented reference type for AML opcode: 0x
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred initializing a namespace object from a parser op. ACPICA has detected an unimplemented reference type. See cpi_ds_init_object_from_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnimplementedRefType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred initializing a namespace object from a parser op. ACPICA has detected an unimplemented data type. See cpi_ds_init_object_from_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnimplementedDataType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A method has been re-entrantly entered too many times. The limit is imposed to avoid a wrap-around on the thread count. Methods should generally not be re-entrantly executred this deep, so it may indicate a bug in the firmware.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMethodMaxRentrancyLimit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot acquire Mutex for method .*, current SyncLevel is too large
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The mutex for a method was not acquired because the sync level was too large. The per-thread sync level must be less or equal to the sync level of the method being executed.  This error occurs because the interpreter attempted to avoid possible deadlocks. See acpi_ds_begin_method_execution().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSyncLevelTooLarge

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid zero thread count in method
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A control thread execution has terminated and the thread count is zero, which should never occur. See acpi_ds_terminate_control_method().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiZeroThreadCount

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Control method has no attached sub-object
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Execution of a control method has failed, there is no method object associated with the resolved node. See acpi_ns_evaluate().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiControlNoSubObject

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Evaluation of object type .* is not supported
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Evaluation of a device, event, mutex, region, thermal or local scope ACPI object types is not allowed. The firmware is buggy. See acpi_ns_evaluate().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalObjectTypeNotSupported

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI method type did not have a method object associated with the node and a NULL object was found instead. Failed to execute a control method.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalMethodObjectNull

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to parse the PnPBIOS resource data, an unknown tag length specifier was found. This is a bug in the firmware resource data.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPnpBios

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: no end tag in resource structure
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to parse the PnPBIOS resource data, there was no end tag in the resource structure.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPnpBios

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI _PRW (Power Resources for Wake) object failed to evaluate when the ACPI driver was attempting to get the wakeup device flags.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogACPIPrwEvalError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: lpc_ich: Resource conflict(s) found affecting iTCO_wdt
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A resource conflict has occurred between ACPI OperationRegions and the same I/O region used by the lpc_ich driver for the Intel TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) timer (iTCO_wdt, this is a watchdog timer that will reboot the machine after its second expiration). According to Intel Controller Hub (ICH) specifications, the TCO watchdog has a 32 bytes I/O space resource. ACPI OperationRegions in the DSDT frequently reserve this TCO I/O space because they require access to bit 9 (DMISCI_STS) of the TCO1_STS register of the TCO, however, this bit is never used by the lpc_ich driver, so there is no risk of conflict. In the vast majority of cases this warning can be ignored as no harm will occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSystemIOConflictLpcIchWatchDogTimer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: lpc_ich: Resource conflict(s) found affecting gpio_ich
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A resource conflict has occurred between ACPI OperationRegions and the same I/O region used by the lpc_ich driver for the General Purpose I/O (GPIO) region. Sometimes this GPIO region is used by the firmware for rfkill or LED controls or very rarely for the Embedded Controller System Control Interrupt. This may require deeper inspection to check if the conflict will lead to any real issues.  However, in the vast majority of cases this warning can be ignored as no harm will occur.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSystemIOConflictLpcIchWatchDogTimer

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A resource conflict between an ACPI OperationRegion and a native driver has been detected. By default the kernel will use a strict policy and will not allow this region to conflict and -EBUSY will be returned to the caller that was trying to allocate the already claimed region.  If an ACPI driver is available for this device then this should be used instead of a native driver, so disabling the native driver may help.  (Note that the lpc_ich driver can trigger these warnings, in which case they can generally be ignored). One can specify kernel boot parameter acpi_enforce_resources=lax to disable these checks but it may lead to random problems and system instability.  Alternatively, one can specify acpi_enforce_resources=no and ACPI Operation Region resources will not be registered.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSystemIOConflict

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: device .* has invalid IRQ.*check vendor BIOS
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error occurred probing the PCI-Express port devices. The device has a valid pin but did not have an a valid IRQ.  This is normally due to a misconfiguration in the firmware.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosIrqInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI thermal driver has attempted to evaluate an ACPI active threshold control _ALx and this failed to evaluate.  This is normally due to broken or buggy _ALx control. This may lead to sub-optimal thermal control.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAlThresholdInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Hyperthreading CPU enumeration failed, hyperthreads will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogCpuNoSiblingFound

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An OHCI BIOS handoff failure generally means that the OHCI driver was unable to take control of the USB controller away from the BIOS. Disabling USB legacy mode in the BIOS may help.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosOhciEmulation

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An EHCI BIOS handoff failure generally means that the EHCI driver was unable to take control of the USB controller away from the BIOS. Disabling USB legacy mode in the BIOS may help.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosEhciEmulation

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An xHCI BIOS handoff failure generally means that the xHCI driver was unable to take control of the USB controller away from the BIOS. Disabling USB legacy mode in the BIOS may help.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosXhciEmulation

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI MCFG has failed to be parsed, it has no entries in it. This is not expected and is most likely an ACPI misconfiguration. The PCI memory mapped configuration space is not known and hence PCI will be not configured.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMcfgNoEntries

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: MMCONFIG not in low 4GB of memory
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI MCFG config entry is not in the lower 4GB (32 bit) address space and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMcfgNotIn32BitMemorySpace

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: MCFG region for .* at .* is above 4GB, ignored
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI MCFG config entry is not in the lower 4GB (32 bit) address space and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMcfgNotin32BitMemorySpace

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A PCI interrupt link could not be enabled when the associated ACPI _STA control was executed. It will be disabled. This is normally a bug in the _STA control for this link.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPciLinkDisabled

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Inconsistent FADT length .* and revision .* using FADT V1.0 portion of table
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI FADT was reporting to be a version 2.0 (or higher) FADT but the length was too short, so the kernel has assumed it was a version 1.0 FADT instead. The machine may have reduced ACPI 1.0 functionality.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFadtInconsistentLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel had detected a spurious interrupt which is generating tens of thousands of interrupts. This can occur if the interrupt is stuck.  The kernel has taken action and disabled this interrupt.  Look at /proc/interrupts to find the devices serviced by this interrupt as these are most probably no functioning now.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogIrqDisabled

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was requested to set a GPE wake mask with an incorrect action, expected ACPI_GPE_ENABLE or ACPI_GPE_DISABLE, see acpi_set_gpe_wake_mask(). This is most probably a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeWakeMaskIncorrect

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was requested to enable or disable a single GPE in a parent enable register but was given an incorrect action, expected  ACPI_GPE_ENABLE or ACPI_GPE_DISABLE, see acpi_hw_low_set_gpe(). This is most probably a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeActionInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was requested to validate a H/W register but the address space ID was not ACPI_ADR_SPACE_SYSTEM_MEMORY or ACPI_ADR_SPACE_SYSTEM_IO.  Other address spaces are not supported by the driver. See acpi_hw_validate_register().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHwRegsUnsupportedAddressSpace

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was requested to validate a H/W register but the bit width of the register was not 8, 16 or 32 bits; other sizes are not suppoted by the driver. See acpi_hw_validate_register().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHwRegsUnsupportedRegisterBitWidth

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was requested the bitmask of a specific register ID which was greater than the the predefined driver maximum of ACPI_BITREG_MAX.  A NULL register info struct was passed back to the caller.  This is normally a driver bug, see acpi_hw_get_bit_register_info().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHwRegsInvalidBitRegisterId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was registed to read an ACPI register, but an invalid register ID was given; was expected withe a PM1 status register, PM1 enable register, PM1 control, PM 2 control, PM timer or a SMI command block.  This is normally a driver bug, see acpi_hw_register_read().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiHwRegsUnknownRegisterId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No handler or method for .*, disabling event
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A General Purpose Event (GPE) has occurred and there does not appear to be a GPE handler for this event.  This should no longer be possible with kernels dating after March 2010.  The GPE is disabled and will not occur until the machine is rebooted. See acpi_ev_gpe_dispatch().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeHandlerMissing

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter was requested to read or write to a memory region via a memory space handler but the requested field width was invalid. It expected a field with of 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits.  This is most probably an AML opregion bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOpRegionInvalidSystemMemoryWidth

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not map memory at 0x.*, size
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter was requested to read or write to a memory region via a memory space handler but the logical address could not be mapped from the given physical address given.  This memory region is not mappable, so it could be an AML opregion bug or a bug in the kernel (less likely).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOpRegionMemMapError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: 32-bit FADT register is too long .* to convert to GAS struct - 255 bits max, truncating
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Generic Address Structure bit_width was greater than 31 which is too large for a 32 bit ACPI FADT register and was truncated.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFadtGasBitWidthTooLong

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not install GPE interrupt handler at level 0x
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to install a General Purpose Event interrupt handler but this failed.  Is the interrupt available or already used? See acpi_ev_get_gpe_xrupt_block().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeHandlerInstallFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter could not execute an unknown AML opcode. This is an ACPI AML firmware bug.  See acpi_ds_exec_end_control_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiUnknownControlOp

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No response from Global Lock hardware, disabling lock
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to send a global lock SMI did not generate a global lock event and so the kernel has concluded that the BIOS global lock handler is not functioning on this hardware.  All subsequent attempts to use the global lock will be flagged with an error.  You may experience race conditions in the ACPI driver.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalLockDisabled

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not signal Global Lock semaphore
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A global lock signal was sent to the firmware using a SMI but this failed to complete correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalLockSignalError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI name started with a leading digit which is illegal. This is a bug in an ACPI table.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNameLeadingDigit

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Am ACPI segment name started with some valid name characters but was shorted than the expected length of 4 characters.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNameWrongSize

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI name had a valid prefix path but there wasn't a valid name following the prefix.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMalformedName

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was attempting to create a new operation region objject as specified by an AML instruction but the provided Space ID was not one of the predefined IDs or in the user-defined range. The operation region is not created. This is an AML bug in the ACPI DSDT or SSDTs.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlOpRegionInvalidAddressSpaceId

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Type returned from .* was incorrect: .*, expected Btypes: 0x
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter was evaluating a namespace object and discovered that the return type did not match the expected return type.  This is an ACPI AML bug in the ACPI DSDT or SSDTs.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIncorrectReturnType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter failed to convert an AML resource into an aligned internal representation of the resource. The resource descriptor was not a recognised type that could be converted. This is an ACPI AML bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidResourceDescriptor

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid descriptor type .* in resource list
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter failed to convert a linked list of resources into an AML buffer because one of the resources had in invalid resource type. This may be a bug in the ACPI resource handling code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidDescriptorType

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter found an AML match operator that was unrecognised, it was expecting MTR, MEQ, etc.  This is a bug in the AML.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMatchOperatorOutOfRange

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter was executing a 6 argument MATCH_OP op-code and discovered that the integer index being used fall outside of the package being referenced.  This is an index overflow or underflow error and is considered to be a bug in the AML.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIndexOutOfPackageRange

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Table has invalid signature .* must be SSDT or OEMx
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver detected an ACPI table with an invalid signature. This table will not be loaded and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidTableSignature

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: The ACPI DSDT has been corrupted or replaced - old, new headers below
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The current loaded DSDT length and/or checksum differ to original version. This could be because it has been altered from outside Linux (perhaps broken firmware or a rootkit) or some incorrect memory write has corrupted the table. A workaround is to boot with the kernel parameter: acpi=copy_dsdt
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDsdtCorrupt

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invalid signature .* for ACPI table, expected .*
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI DSDT and FACS tables must have correct signatures otherwise the ACPI driver treats them as suspect or corrupt and will not load them.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableSignatureInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI RSDT and XSDT must have the correct length. These variable length tables contain pointers to other ACPI tables and stated length that is different than the actual length can imply that the these tables are not trustworthy and hence the ACPI driver cannot tell if the pointers are totally valid or not.  The driver will ignore these tables and ACPI will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTableLengthInvalid

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Required FADT field .* has zero address and.*or length
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI FADT fields Pm1a_event, Pm1a_control, pm_timer are required fields that must have a defined (non-zero) address and a length that is non-zero.  One of these fields is incorrect and needs fixing.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFadtFieldZeroAddrLength

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver could not convert an AML resource to an internal representation of the resource that is aligned and easier to access. This is most likely to be because their is an unrecognised ACPI resource op-code.  See acpi_rs_convert_aml_to_resource() for details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiAmlResourceConvertFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver could not covert a resource linked list into an AML bytestream. See acpi_rs_convert_resources_to_aml() for details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiResourceToAmlFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not get result from predicate evaluation
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to pop a result off the result stack while evaluating a predicate. This is probably an AML code firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPredicateEvalPopFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to initialize a name space operation region. This is most probably the _REG (Region) control failed to evaluate.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRegInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to evaluate the _PRS (Possible Resource Settings) object. This failure will lead to a PCI link not being added to the system.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPrsEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to evaluate the _CRS (Current Resource Settings) object to get the current IRQ assignment. This failure will lead to a PCI link not allocating an IRQ.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCrsEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to evaluate the _SRS (Set Resource Settings) object to set the current link resource. This failure will lead to a PCI link not allocating an IRQ.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSrsEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to execute an ACPI sleep method but this failed to execute. This is most probably an ACPI firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSleepMethodFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver got a missing or NULL operand while translating a parse tree object that is an argument to an AML object. This is more likely to be poorly written or compiled AML rather than an ACPI parser bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiParseMissingNullOp

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to convert an operator's arguments from a parse tree format to a namespace object during the parse.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOpArgCreateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to get the ACPI battery state but the _BST (Battery Status) failed to evaluate. This is most likely to be a firmware or embedded controller bug. The ACPI battery state cannot be reported to userspace.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBsrEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to get the current CPU performance states but the _PPC (Performance Present Capabilities) method failed to evaluate. The CPU frequency policy will not be updated.  This may explain why CPU frequencies are locked at one setting and do not change.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPpcEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to get the CPU performance control and status registers but the _PCT (Performance Control) object failed to evaluate. This error normally occurs because the BIOS is an old or that it does not know the CPU frequencies.  CPU frequency support is not supported.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPctEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to get the CPU performance states bug the _PSS (Performance Supported States) object failed to evaluate. This error normally occurs because the BIOS is an old or that it does not know the CPU frequencies.  CPU frequency support is not supported.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPssEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Failed to write pstate_control .* to smi_command
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to update the P states but the P state control command written to the SMI command port failed to write.  This could be because that ACPI FADT SMI command or FADT P State control settings are incorrect, or that the port write just failed (which is very unlikely).
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPstateControlSmiCommandFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This is most probably caused by when a read or write operation to the EC memory has failed because of a timeout waiting for the Embedded Controller to complete the transaction.  Normally, the kernel waits for 500ms for the Embedded Controller status port to indicate that a transaction is complete, but in this case it has not and a AE_TIME error has been returned.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTimeOutReturnedByHandler

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver detected an error returned by a region handler.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRegionHandlerError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver detected an error when attempting to execute an ACPI_REG_DISCONNECT on a _REG (Region) method.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRegDisconnectFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver detected an error when attempting to deactivate a region. This error is ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRegDeactivateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver found not resolve an operand for the AML AML_DECREMENT_OP (0x76) or AML_INCREMENT_OP (0x75) instructions. This is due to buggy AML code and not a ACPI driver bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIncDecNoOperands

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not update object reference count
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to update the reference count to an internal ACPI object. Reference counts are incremented when an object is attached to a node or an object is copied and decremented when an object is detected from a node.  This failure will lead to object garbage collection failing to operate correctly. This is considered a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiObjRefCountError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not write ACPI mode change
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to inform the firmware (via a System Management Interrupt) that the machine was transitioning to or from ACPI or legacy mode but this failed. This normally indicates that either SMIs are failing or the firmware is buggy. Normally if this fails to transition to ACPI mode then ACPI is not enabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiModeChangeFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to find an object while parsing a named Op, see acpi_ps_build_named_op().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNamedObjLookupFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Invoked method did not return a value
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An invoked ACPI method did not return a value but it was expected to. This could lead to unexpected ACPI execution behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMethodNoReturnValue

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to get a predicate for the AML opcodes IF or WHILE. This normally is because of faulty AML code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiIfWhilePredicateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was initializing the ACPI namespace and adding pre-defined names but this failed on this particular object. This should not happen.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPredefinedNameCreateFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: While loading namespace from ACPI tables
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to load the namespace from the DSDT and SSDTs/PSDTs found in the RSDT/XDSDT. This will lead to the ACPI driver being disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNameSpaceLoadFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: While evaluating SleepState .* bad Sleep object .* type .*
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to evaluate an ACPI sleep control while trying to obtain the SLP_TYPa and SLP_TYPb values for the requested sleep state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiSlpEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to asynchronously execute an ACPI General Purpose Event (GPE) but this failed because the kernel ran out of free memory to allocate a GPE event information buffer.  The event was not handled, this may lead to unpredictable behaviour.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeNoMemory

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to asynchronously execute an ACPI General Purpose Event (GPE) but the ACPI GPE method failed for some unknown reason. This is most likely a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An edge triggered ACPI General Purpose Event (GPE) occurred and the clearing of the GPE status bit failed. This is normally a low-level hardware I/O register write failure. This may lead to this GPE failing to be handled again.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeClearFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An ACPI General Purpose Event (GPE) could not be disabled.  These are disabled to ensure the GPE does not keep firing before the asynchronous GPE handler completes.  The failure to disable the GPE may lead to further GPEs being triggered and causing some unexpected handling failures.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeDisableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Unable to queue handler for GPE
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to dispatch the GPE asynchronously. The GPE will not be properly handled and will be ignored.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeQueueHandlerFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to initialize, the kernel specific OS dependent layer failed to initialize. This is a kernel bug and ACPI will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOsLayerInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to initialize, could not initialize the globals used by the subsystem. This is a kernel bug and ACPI will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalsInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to initialize, could not initialize the global mutex. This is a kernel bug and ACPI will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalMutexInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to initialize, could not initialize the ACPI global namespace manager and root namespace tree. ACPI will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNamespaceInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to initialize, could not initialize the ACPI OSI interfaces. ACPI will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOsiInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed initialize the General Purpose Events (GPE) Block 0. This means that GPEs for this block will be not handled and so some devices or controls may not work correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeBlock0InitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed initialize the General Purpose Events (GPE) Block 1. This means that GPEs for this block will be not handled and so some devices or controls may not work correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeBlock1InitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to decode level _Lxx or edge _Exx methods for newly added ACPI tables.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeLevelOrEdgeMethodDecodeFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to enable a General Purpose Event (GPE).  A GPE event handler will not be executed for this GPE and this may mean some form of loss of functionality with specific devices.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGpeEnableFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver has responded to an ACPI processor hotplug event and attempted to execute the _STA (Status) control for a processor but this failed. _STA is mandatory for a processor that supports hot plug and so the driver has not added the processor to the running system.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiCpuHotPlugStaFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Could not install PciConfig handler for Root Bridge
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver could not install a PCI Config operation region for a PCI Root Bridge. This could occur for a variety of reasons but it is most probably because the devices _REG (Region) control failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPciConfigInstallFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to traverse the ACPI namespace either during namespace initialization. ACPI will be disabled.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiWalkNamespaceFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to traverse the ACPI namespace and initialize all the ACPI devices.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNsDevInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to initialize methods or op regions during the namespace traversal.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNsExecArgFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver has thrown this exeption because of one of the two cases: 1. Either a trip point has becomes invalid when re-evaluating the AML code or, 2. devices listed in _PSL, _ALx or _TZD may have changed and the driver needs to re-bind to the cooling devices of a thermal zone when that happens.  This execption probably means the ACPI thermal driver needs to cater for this behaviour and it needs fixing or updating.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiThermTripPointChanged

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was attempting to notify a memory device but could not find a parent to the given device handle. This is an internal ACPI driver error and should not occur.  ACPI memory hotplug failures may occur because of this failure.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMemHotPlugParentError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to power down a memory hot plug device but the ACPI _EJ0 (Eject) control failed which leaves the hotplug memory device in an invalid state.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMemHotPlugEj0Failed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to traverse the ACPI object namespace to allow it to register any memory hotplug notify handlers. This failure means that ACPI memory hotplug will not work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMemHotPlugInitFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver executed the _DCK (Dock) control but this failed to complete successfully. This control is executed when an ACPI docking or undocking event is received.  This may be because of a fault _DCK control or that the hardware isn't functioning correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDckEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to enumerate the ACPI video devices because the _DOD (Enumerate All Devices Attached to the Display Adapter) control failed.  This may explain why the video device is not functioning correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDodEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI control _DOD (Enumerate All Devices Attached to the Display Adapter) returned either a NULL package or not did not return an ACPI_PACKAGE type as expected.  This may explain why the video device is not functioning correctly.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDodInvalidData

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was requested to get the status of a ACPI General Purpose Event or Fixed Event that did not exist. This is an unexpected driver error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiInvalidGpe

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to get the PCI Routing Table for a device because the evaluation of _PRT (PCI Routing Table) failed. This will lead to the device not having the IRQ wired up to the correct slot/device/pin. Without this, the device cannot handle interrupts and will fail to work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPrtEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver attempted to physically map an ACPI table but this failed.  This table will not be used and this can lead to unexpected behaviour and loss of functionality.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTablePhysMapFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Global Lock is a mutex that ensures exclusive access to resources controlled by the ACPI driver. This lock failed to be acquired which normally means that the kernel mutex has failed, which should never occur.  This is normally considered a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalLockAcquireFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI Global Lock is a mutex that ensures exclusive access to resources controlled by the ACPI driver. This lock failed to be release which normally means that the kernel mutex has failed, which should never occur.  This is normally considered a kernel bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiGlobalLockReleaseFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI memory hotplug failed to add a memory device, acpi_memory_enable_device() failed. This occurs if the memory block has already been used by the kernel or if add_memory() failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMemHotPlugFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver could not read the AC adapter state because the ACPI control _PSR (Power Source) failed to evaluate. This could be because this control did not exist or more probably that it failed to execute because of an error between the firmware and the smart battery.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPsrEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: failed to add I2C device .* from ACPI
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create an I2C device while walking through the ACPI namespace enumerating I2C slave devices behind the adapter.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiI2CAddFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot turn wakeup power resources on
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was preparing to wakeup a device by powering on the power resources required for the device but one of these resources failed to power on.  See acpi_enable_wakeup_device_power().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPowerWakeupResources

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Cannot turn wakeup power resources off
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver was preparing to shutdown a wakeup device by powering off the power resources for the device but one of these resources failed to power off. See acpi_disable_wakeup_device_power().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiPowerWakeupResources

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Processor() failed to evaluate. ACPI could not gather information on a CPU which will lead to it not being used.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiProcessorEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI failed to evaluate a processor _UID object (as declared in a Device statement).  ACPI could not gather information on a CPU which will lead to it not being used.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiProcessorEvalFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI driver failed to get the current number of supported CPU throttling T States because the ACPI control _TPC (Throttling Present Capabilities) failed to evaluate.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiTpcEvalFailed
