firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS bug.*no explicit IRQ entries.*using default mptable
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The MultiProcessor table contains no IRQ Entry Fields, and hence there are no IRQs defined. The table is broken and should be fixed. The kernel will set up the low 16 IO-APIC pins to the ISA defaults in the hope the machine may work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMptableNoIRQentries

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS bug.*timer not connected to IO-APIC
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS is reporting the ExtINTA I/O APIC input from the cascaded 8259A as the timer interrupt input.  The kernel has detected just one pin, so it has to check the timer directly and through the 8259A because of the broken BIOS reporting.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosTimerNotConnectedtoIoApic

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: BIOS bug,.*IO-APIC.*ID is.*in the MPC table.*
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The IO-APIC id in the MPC table is wrong and the kernel has detected this and attempted to fix it. The MPC table in the firmware needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosIoApicInMpcTable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The IO-APIC id has been defined more than once in the MPC table, which is a firmware bug and should be fixed. The kernel has detected this and skopped this duplication to avoid stuck on smp_invalidate_needed IPI wait' messages.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosIoApicIdAlreadyUsed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: WARNING.*BIOS bug.*CPU MTRRs don't cover all of memory, losing
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are misconfigued by the BIOS and don't appear to cover all available physical memory. The kernel has detected this and has reduced the amount of memory available to be safe. Either check that the BIOS memory caching options are set correctly or contact your BIOS vendor to get this fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosCpuMtrrMisconfigured

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: A device driver has tried to allocate a Memory Type Range Register (MTRR) to optimially configure a caching policy on a memory region but there are no more free MTRRs available.  Generally the firmware should allow for one or two free MTRRs for drivers to allocate.  The system will have a sub-optimally configured memory region and this may severely impact on performance.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosNoMoreMtrrsAvailable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The DRM driver has tried to allocate a Memory Type Range Register (MTRR) but there are no more free MTRRs available. The system will have a sub-optimally configured graphics memory region and this may severely impact on graphics rendering throughput and performance.  The firmware should allow for one or two free MTRRs, but it hasn't, which is probably a firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrAllocationFailed

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your BIOS has configured an incorrect mask, fixing it
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are misconfigued by the BIOS. In this case, the mask is incorrectly set and the kernel has detected this and worked around the firmware bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrIncorrectMask

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your CPUs had inconsistent fixed MTRR settings
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The fixed Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are not consistent across all CPUs which is a firmware bug. The kernel has worked around this bug, but it may be worth getting the BIOS vendor to fix this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrsInconsistentAcrossCPUs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your CPUs had inconsistent variable MTRR settings
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The variable Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy are not consistent across all CPUs which is a firmware bug. The kernel has worked around this bug, but it may be worth getting the BIOS vendor to fix this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrsInconsistentAcrossCPUs

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*your CPUs had inconsistent MTRRdefType settings
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) which define memory caching policy do not have a MTRRdefType consistently set across all CPUs which is a firmware bug. The kernel has worked around this bug, but it may be worth getting the BIOS vendor to fix this.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrDefTypeIncosistent

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) for Intel PPro CPUs with stepping < 8 must be 4 MiB aligned and not touch 0x70000000 -> 0x7003FFFF. This BIOS misconfiguration and should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrNot4MbAligned

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*writable mtrr between 0x70000000 and 0x7003FFFF may hang the CPU
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) for Intel PPro CPUs with stepping < 8 must not touch region 0x70000000 -> 0x7003FFFF. This BIOS misconfiguration may hang the CPU and should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrMayHangCPU

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: mtrr:.*base.*is not aligned on a size.*boundary
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Memory Type Range Registers (MTRRs) must be correctly aligned. This BIOS misconfiguration and should be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogBiosMtrrNotAlignedCorrectly

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI Method _DOD (Enumerate all devices attached to display adapter) is defined but we should also have _DOS (Enable/Disable output switching) defined but it's been omitted.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDodWithNoDos

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: WARNING:.*bogus zero IO-APIC address found in MPTABLE
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An IO-APIC address of zero has been found in the MPTABLE and is thus treated as misconfigured or bogus. I/O APIC support has been disabled. This is considered a firmware bug and the MPTABLE needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBogusIoApicInMptable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: An IO-APIC address of zero has been found in the MPTABLE and is thus treated as misconfigured or bogus. I/O APIC support has been disabled. This is considered a firmware bug and the MPTABLE needs to be fixed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiBogusIoApicInMptable

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Try video module parameter video.allow_duplicates=1 if the current driver does't work.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiDuplicateAcpiVideoBus

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]:.*PCI.*MMCONFIG.*not reserved in ACPI motherboard resources
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: It appears that PCI config space has been configured for a specific device but does not appear to be reserved by the ACPI motherboard resources.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiMmconfigNotReserved

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: \[Firmware Bug\]: PCI.*not reserved in ACPI motherboard resources
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: PCI firmware bug. Please see the kernel log for more details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogPciNotReserved

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: This is not exactly a failure mode but a warning from the kernel. The _OSI() method has implemented a match to the 'Linux' query in the DSDT and this is redundant because the ACPI driver matches onto the Windows _OSI strings by default.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiOsiLinuxIgnored

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI driver has detected an ACPI bug. This generally points to a bug in an ACPI table. Examine the kernel log for more details.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFirmwareError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: cpu .* try to use APIC.* for vector .*, but the register is already in use for vector .* on another cpu
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The local vector table (LVT) offsets that provided by firmware have conflicts, the assignment to the same offset causes the second APIC setup failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogLVTOffsetAssignConflict

firmware_error_warning_patterns.pattern: cpu .* try to use APIC.* for vector .*, but the register is already in use for vector .* on this cpu
firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The local vector table (LVT) offsets that provided by firmware have conflicts, the assignment to the same offset causes the second APIC setup failed.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogLVTOffsetAssignConflict

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has detected a Firmware bug in the BIOS or ACPI which needs investigating and fixing.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiFirmwareError

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has detected an error trying to execute a method and it cannot find an object. This indicates a bug in the DSDT or SSDT AML code.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNamespaceLookupFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: While evaluating one object, ACPI could not find another object that was being referenced. This indicates a bug in the DSDT or the SSDTs.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiNamespaceLookupFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI engine has failed to execute some AML. The error message above lists the method that caused this error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiParseOrExecFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The kernel has most probably detected an error while executing ACPI AML. The error lists the ACPI driver module and the line number where the bug has been caught and the method that caused the error.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiExecFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: The ACPI interpreter was requested to evaluate an ACPI namespace object and was expecting an ACPI object to be returned, but nothing was returned.  This appears to be an ACPI AML bug.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiEvalObjNoObjReturned

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Execution of an ACPI AML method failed. This is normally a bug in the ACPI AML code
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiExecFailure

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI method reached maximum reentrancy limit of 255 - infinite recursion in AML in DSTD or SSDT
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRecursionTooDeep

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: ACPI method has reached reentrancy limit, this is a recursion bug in the AML.
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiRecursionTooDeep

firmware_error_warning_patterns.advice: Return object type is not the correct type, this is an AML error in the DSDT or SSDT. See also acpi_ut_evaluate_object().
firmware_error_warning_patterns.label: KlogAcpiReturnObjectTypeIncorrect

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: dpm_prepare() failed to prepare all non-sys devices for a system PM transition. The device should be listed in the error message.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmFailedToPrepareDevice

pm_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PM: Some devices failed to power down
pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: dpm_suspend_noirq failed because some devices did not power down
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmDevicesFailedToPowerDown

pm_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PM: Some system devices failed to power down
pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: sysdev_suspend failed because some system devices did not power down.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmSystemDevicesFailedToPowerDown

pm_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PM: Some devices failed to power down
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmDevicesFailedToPowerDown

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: A resume from hibernate failed when calling hibernation_restore()
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmResumeFromHibernateFailed

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: There was not enough physical memory to be able to generate a hibernation image before dumping it to disc.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmNotEnoughFreeMemory

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: swusp_alloc() failed trying to allocate highmem and failing that non-highmem pages for the suspend image. There is probably just not enough free physical memory available.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmMemoryAllocationFailed

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: Mismatch in kernel version, system type, kernel release version or machine id between suspended kernel and resumed kernel.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmKernelMismatch

pm_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PM: Some devices failed to power down
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmDevicesFailedToPowerDown

pm_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PM: Some devices failed to suspend
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmDevicesFailedToSuspend

pm_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PM: no wakealarm-capable RTC driver is ready
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmNoWakeAlarmRealTimeClock

pm_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PM: Adding page to bio failed at
pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to write the hibernate image to disk failed because a write BIO operation failed. This is usually a result of some physical hardware problem.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmPhysicalDiskWriteError

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to write a hibernate image to disk failed because a valid swap device header could not be found. Make sure there is a formatted swap device on the machine and it is added using swapon -a.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmSwapHeaderNotFound

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: An attempt to write a hibernate image to disk failed because the swap device could not be found. Make sure there is a formatted swap device on the machine and it is added using swapon -a.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmCannotFindSwapDevice

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: Hibernate failed because the swap parition was probably too small.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmNotEnoughFreeSwap

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: The BIOS seems to be corrupting the first 64K of memory when doing suspend/resume. Setting bios_corruption_check=0 will disable this check.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmBiosCorruptFirst64K

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: Possibly an Intel I/O controller hub HPET Write Timing issue: A read transaction that immediately follows a write transaction to the HPET TIMn_COMP Timer 0 (108h), HPET MAIN_CNT (0F0h), or TIMn_CONF.bit 6 (100h) may return an incorrect value.  This is known to cause issues when coming out of S3.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmHpetWriteTimingIssue

pm_error_warning_patterns.advice: Softlock errors that occur when coming out of S3 may be tripped by TSC warping.  It may be worth trying the notsc kernel parameter and repeating S3 tests to see if this solves the problem.
pm_error_warning_patterns.label: PmProcessSoftLockup
